newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-RANGERS HELD BUT CELTIC FAIL TO TAKE ADVANTAGE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RANGERS HELD BUT CELTIC FAIL TO TAKE ADVANTAGE.

text.p: Scottish champions Glasgow Rangers were held 0-0 at home by Hearts on Saturday but rivals Celtic failed to take advantage, losing 1-0 at Dundee United to an 89th minute goal by a former Rangers player.
Gary McSwegan beat Celtic goalkeeper Stewart Kerr with a lob just six minutes after coming on as a substitute.
The result left Celtic seven points adrift of at the top of the premier division with 11 games to play.
Dundee United have now won their last eight matches and are third, 12 points behind Celtic.
At Ibrox, the champions, chasing a record-equalling ninth consecutive league title, dominated a largely uneventful match but failed to break down a stubborn Hearts defence.
